main.java.latexee.declareast

Class OperatorDeclaration

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.latexee.declareast.DeclareNode
      • main.java.latexee.declareast.OperatorDeclaration

  • public class OperatorDeclaration
extends DeclareNode
    OperatorDeclaration is a class, which inherits from DeclareNode. OperatorDeclaration holds information about user-defined operators, like \declare{syntax={infix, 7, /, l}, meaning=arith1.divide} Instances of this class hold information about operator's meaning, type (infix/prefix/etc), parsing priority, character(s) used by the operator, associativity (left- or right-associative) content dictionary and misc information.

        priority - priority of the operator (syntax={.., 7, ..})

      • toGrammarRule

        public java.lang.String toGrammarRule()
        Method to translate the OperatorDeclaration object to a grammar rule, which is used to write the grammar rules. Increments the operator priority counter by one, so we know how to link the priorities in grammar.
        Specified by:
        toGrammarRule in class DeclareNode
        Returns:
        string representation of the OperatorDeclaration's grammar rule.
